ygData.messageBody:
Thanks to both you & The Scotts for your explanations...I FINALLY
understand!

Heh, but I have a follow-up question <g>.

Why bother EVER specializing in anything but the one you want over 50? Umm,
rephrased:

When you specialize (at skill lvl 1), do you immediately start seeing
mana/casting/recovery time in that spell-type?

I'm only GUESSING the answer is that when you specialize (even at lvl 1)
your mana goes further. As you go up in Specialization, your mana (cost per
spell in time/mana/recovery) goes even further until you reach 50. At 51,
your main Specialization continues its mana-costsavings while your other 4
Specializations - while not getting worse - languish behind your main
Specialization.

Does that make sense, and am I close to understanding?

----- Original Message -----
From: Lanadina the Magician <lanadina@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 30, 1999 3:04 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] ARGH


> From: Lanadina the Magician <lanadina@...>
>
> Dan,
>
> Ok...let me try to explain very very simply =)
>
> When you specialize in a skill, that is completely seperate from your
normal
> skill, (EX. Alteration). My cleric isnt high enough to specialize, but I
> have a level 25 magician who has specialized in both Conjuration and
> Evocation. I use Conjuration alot more, so I will let that one go past the
> 50 mark. Once the SPECIALIZATION skill goes over 50, that ONE will be the
> skill you master at...the other skills that you specialize will be capped
at
> 50. That does not mean that your actual skill in Conjuration or any other
> skill will stop moving up. Look at Specialization as another skill
entirely.
>
> Once you are able to specialize (I beleive you have to be level 30 to do
> that as a Cleric) you will need to go to your guild trainer, and put ONE
> point in whatever skill you want to specialize in. As a cleric, I will
want
> to do Alteration, so I use less mana when I heal, cast faster, and with
less
> interruptions. Once you have ONE POINT in there, it will go up as you
play
> in EQ. You will see when it goes up with a message like, Your
specialization
> (Conjuration) has increased! (25) or whatever you have in that skill. By
the
> time you are level 30, your skill in Alteration is already going to rock,
> (about 150 or so). So, whatever skills you have, they will keep rising,
the
> only thing that will stop rising, is if you specialize in more than one
> skill, and one of them has gone over 50 skill. Everything will keep going
> up, until you hit 50 in specialize, and the one that went over 50 first,
> will keep rising. (Phew, I hope I didnt confuzzle you more)
>
> Specialization Alteration and Alteration are TWO different skills. Both
will
> keep going up =)
>
>
>
> Hope this clarifies it!
>
> Lanadina
>
